result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List- State of Wisconsin
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.

2:37pm. Defendant Joseph J Solomon in court.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Joseph J Solomon. Attorney Lillian Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State calls witness officer A. R. duly sworn and testified. Atty. Nelson with direct. Witness identified DE in courtroom. Atty. Idlas with cross. State moves for bindover, reserves argument. DE objects to bindover, waives argument. State gives argument for felony charge. Atty. Idlas responds, gives argument. Court finds PC for BO to branch.

1:32 PM Defendant Joseph J Solomon in court.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Joseph J Solomon.  Prosecuting attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 01:20 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Diego D. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 7

03:49 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
